title: Number of out-of-area placements for adults with learning difficulties, mental health disorders and complex needs

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Under the Freedom of Information Act 2000 please could you provide details of the following commissioning information:
Part 1
(a) The total number of adults in each local authority who are placed outside the local authority receiving care/support with a learning difficulty.
(b) The total number of adults in each local authority who are placed outside the local authority receiving care/support with a mental health disorder.
(c) The total number of adults in each local authority who are placed outside the local authority receiving care/support with complex needs.
Part 2
If available, please could the above information for parts 1a, 1b and 1c also be provided by calendar month in 2022.
Format
Please could the above information please be provided in Excel or CSV format.
Yours faithfully,
Andrew W

Dear Andrew Whyte,
Thank you for your request for information relating to number of
out-of-area placements for adults with learning difficulties, mental
health disorders and complex needs which we received on 09/12/2022.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
Before we can begin to process your FOI Request, we would like to clarify
what information you require.
Your request asks for the number of out of area placements for adults with
learning disabilities, mental health disorders and complex needs.
For statutory national reporting in adult social care people are
classified as belonging to one of the following primary support reasons:
Physical Support: Access & mobility only
Physical Support: Personal care support
Sensory Support: Support for visual impairment
Sensory Support: Support for hearing impairment
Sensory Support: Support for dual impairment
Support with Memory & Cognition
Learning Disability Support
Mental Health Support
Social Support: Substance misuse support
Social Support: Asylum seeker support
Social Support: Support for Social Isolation / Other
For your request for people with learning disabilities, we can use the
primary support reason of “Learning Disability Support” to identify this
cohort.
For your request for people with mental health disorders, we can use the
primary support reason of “Mental Health Support” to identify this
cohort.
However, there are a large number of definitions of “complex needs” in
existence and people are not categorised as such on our systems.  For your
request for numbers of people with complex needs placed out of city, can
you please either provide an exact definition of the cohort you are
interested in or define which remaining nationally defined primary support
reasons above you believe this cohort to belong to?
Also, can you please confirm if you are interested in people in all
settings or just care homes?
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to a
request within 20 working days. The 20 working day clock will start the
day after we receive the necessary clarification.
You can provide your clarification by replying to this email. Please
note, if clarification is not received within 1 month your Freedom of
Information request will be closed.
We look forward to hearing from you.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
